XCIX. Vitellius, finding that the advanced parties of the enemy had made an irruption into Italy, and news big with danger arriving from every quarter, gave orders to his generals to take the field without delay. Caecina undertook the command, while Valens, who was just risen from a sick bed, remained at Rome for the recovery of his health.
